alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 1:33PM EDT until July 05 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Boone County in central West Virginia... East Central Lincoln County in central West Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 133 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madison, Julian, Danville, Foster, Turtle Creek and Woodville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
